steps:
Step 1: Evaluate f(-2)
Since -2 ≤ 1, we use the first piece: f(x) = x² - 4
f(-2) = (-2)² - 4 = 4 - 4 = 0

Step 2: Evaluate f(1)
Since 1 ≤ 1, we use the first piece: f(x) = x² - 4
f(1) = 1² - 4 = 1 - 4 = -3

Step 3: Evaluate f(3)
Since 3 > 1, we use the second piece: f(x) = 3x - 2
f(3) = 3(3) - 2 = 9 - 2 = 7
content.explanation: When evaluating piecewise functions, the key is to carefully check which condition applies to your input value. Pay special attention to boundary points and whether inequalities are strict (< or >) or inclusive (≤ or ≥).
